intro: Corymbium scabrum, commonly known as the rough corymbium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. Its leaves are generally rough to the touch, giving the plant its common name. Corymbium scabrum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
